title: Protocol for investigating the effect of food digestion in C. elegans on development by feeding the inedible bacteria Staphylococcus saprophyticus
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Preparation of feeding plates for C. elegans
Timing: 2 days
In this section, freshly prepared bacteria will be spread onto NGM plates in the clean bench.
Prepare heat-killed E. coli OP50 (HK-E. coli).
Inoculate 200 mL of LB media with a single colony from a new E. coli OP50 streak plate.
Grow bacteria at 37°C for 16–22 h, shaking at 250 rpm.
Concentrate the cultured E. coli OP50 (200 mL) to 20 mL (1/10 vol) by centrifuging (2,000 g, 15 min).
Vortex the pellet to resuspend it.
Heat-kill the concentrated E. coli OP50 in a water bath at 80°C for 120 min.
Spread 500 μL of the heat-killed E. coli on a LB plate to look for colony growth. Incubate the plate at 37°C for 16–22 h. No bacterial growth confirms the success of heat-killing.
Prepare S. saprophyticus (ATCC 15305):
Inoculate 5 mL of LB media with a single colony from a new S. saprophyticus (SS) streak plate.
Grow bacteria at 37°C for 16–22 h, shaking at 250 rpm.
Transfer 0.5 mL cultured SS (37°C in LB broth) into 50 mL of fresh LB broth. Grow the diluted bacteria at 37°C to OD600 = 0.5, which takes about 5–6 h.
Seed 300 μL of SS onto each NGM plate (6 cm). Let the SS plates grow at 20°C for 24 h to ensure that they are completely dry.
Critical: Freshly prepared SS plates are used to assay developmental phenotype. Plates may be kept at 20°C for up to 3 days before use.
Prepare feeding plates (HK-E. coli + S.saprophyticus):
Mix HK-E. coli OP50 and S.saprophyticus at a 1:1 ratio (ratio = volume: volume).

Note: ratio = volume:volume, for example: 10 mL HK-E. coli OP50 mixed with 10 mL S.saprophyticus. The total amount of bacteria to mix depends on how many plates are required.
Spread 400 μL of the mixed bacteria onto NGM plates (6 cm), and let the plates dry at 20°C–25°C.
Synchronize worms
Timing: 1 day
In this step, bleach adult worms to obtain a synchronized L1-staged population, then seed animals onto the NGM plates with SS or HK-E. coli + SS food.
Synchronize worms and obtain a synchronous L1 population.
Petri dishes with a large number of laid eggs and well-fed gravid adults are used for egg preparations. 5 plates of well-fed adult animals are required.
Wash adult worms and eggs from each plate with 1 mL M9 buffer, and transfer the worms into a 15 mL tube.
Collect the worms by centrifugation at 50 g for 3 min.
Remove the supernatant, and add 5 mL of bleach solution.
Note: the bleach solution (see materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment]) should be freshly made.
Gently resuspend the pelleted worms in this solution, and gently shake the tube for 5 min on a rocker.
Pellet the worms by centrifugation at 50 g for 1 min and remove the bleach solution.
Wash the eggs with M9 buffer (5 mL/tube), centrifuge at 50 g for 1 min. Repeat this step two more times.
Resuspend eggs in 5 mL M9 buffer in a 15 mL tube.
Gently shake the tube for 12–15 h, which will generate synchronized L1-staged worms.
Seeding of animals and analysis of larval growth
Timing: 4 days
Seed L1 animals to the plates.
Pellet synchronized L1 animals in the 15 mL tube and remove the M9 medium.

Resuspend the synchronized L1 in 500 μL M9, and then put 5–10 μL of L1 animals onto a microscope slide and count the number of animals. The ideal animal number is 100–200 worms/10 μL.
Seed synchronized L1 animals (100–200 worms/10 μL) each plate prepared for the specific assay (SS, HK-E. coli + SS) and incubate at 20°C for 3–4 days.
Note: At least 3 plates (one plate for each technical replicate) were used for each condition.
Measure the developmental rate of the animals at day 4 based on vulval morphology.5[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5]
Note: Observe the animals at day 3 and day 4, and measure the developmental stage at day 4.
